documentation.text: @dev Thrown when the callback caller is not the host.
@dev Thrown if a required callback wasn't implemented (overridden by the SuperApp)
@dev Thrown when SuperTokens not accepted by the SuperApp are streamed to it

@dev Initializes the contract by setting the expected Superfluid Host.
      and register which callbacks the Host can engage when appropriate.

@dev override if the SuperApp shall have custom logic invoked when a new flow
      to it is created.

@dev override if the SuperApp shall have custom logic invoked when an existing flow
      to it is updated (flowrate change).

@dev override if the SuperApp shall have custom logic invoked when an existing flow
      to it is deleted (flowrate set to 0).
      Unlike the other callbacks, this method is NOT allowed to revert.
      Failing to satisfy that requirement leads to jailing (defunct SuperApp).

NotAcceptedSuperToken().details: Thrown when SuperTokens not accepted by the SuperApp are streamed to it

NotImplemented().details: Thrown if a required callback wasn't implemented (overridden by the SuperApp)

UnauthorizedHost().details: Thrown when the callback caller is not the host.

constructor.details: Initializes the contract by setting the expected Superfluid Host.      and register which callbacks the Host can engage when appropriate.

isAcceptedSuperToken(address).details: Optional (positive) filter for accepting only specific SuperTokens.      The default implementation accepts all SuperTokens.      Can be overridden by the SuperApp in order to apply arbitrary filters.
